original_reasoning:
Okay, I need to figure out what code to put in place of the TODO comment in the CaffeineDemo class. The task is to build a cache with a maximum size of 100 and entries expiring 10 minutes after writing. 

First, I remember that Caffeine's builder is used to configure the cache. The method starts with Caffeine.newBuilder(). Then, to set the maximum size, there's a method called maximumSize(100). The expiration after write is handled by expireAfterWrite(10, TimeUnit.MINUTES), which is already present in the code. So the missing part is the maximum size configuration.

Putting it all together, the code should chain the maximumSize method after the builder and before expireAfterWrite. So the line would be:

Caffeine.newBuilder().maximumSize(100).expireAfterWrite(10, TimeUnit.MINUTES).build();

Wait, the existing code already has the expireAfterWrite line. So the TODO is where the builder starts. The current line is:

Cache<String, String> cache = /* TODO: Your code here */ .expireAfterWrite(10, TimeUnit.MINUTES).build();

So the missing part must start with Caffeine.newBuilder(), then add maximumSize(100), then the existing expireAfterWrite. So the TODO line should be replaced with:

Caffeine.newBuilder().maximumSize(100)

So the full line would be:

Cache<String, String> cache = Caffeine.newBuilder().maximumSize(100).expireAfterWrite(10, TimeUnit.MINUTES).build();

Therefore, the missing code is Caffeine.newBuilder().maximumSize(100)
